result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua H Rinka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua H Rinka

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:41 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Joshua H Rinka in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Joshua H Rinka. 

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads no contest to Count 3.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 3.
Counts 1, 2, & 4 are dismissed and read into Count 3.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.

The Court recesses at 02:51 PM for the Defendant to pay upfront restitution. 
The Court recalls the matter at PM with the same appearances.

Court orders the following:
	
Fine:  $326.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges: Defendant to pay within 60 days.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, then click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.

Adjustment Number: 22A 028787,
Payable Number: 470308,
Receipt Number: 22R 030933,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua H Rinka
Current: 814 Niagara St, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: N67w28335 Weber Ave, Hartland, WI 53029
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Woodman's listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:42 AM Defendant Joshua H Rinka in court with attorney Jessica Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
